Class ConversionCompiler

java.lang.Object
Tools.Conversions.ConversionCompiler
public class ConversionCompiler extends Object
This class acts as a compiler of all the different unit converters so that they may be easily accessed by the UnitConverter class. It is meant to be strictly referenced from static contexts
Version:
1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • getConversion

      public static DataPoint getConversion(DataPoint d, String str, String conversiontype)
      Returns a converted DataPoint from a given type of unit conversion
      Parameters:
      d - The DataPoint to be converted
      str - The new units for the DataPoint to be converted to
      conversiontype - The tag identifier of the desired ConversionType for the operation
      Returns:
      Returns a converted DataPoint from a given DataPoint to a new DataPoint with formatted units str
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if there is no ConversionType on the array with a matching tag identifier to conversiontype

    • findConversion

      public static ConversionType findConversion(String str)
      Returns a ConversionType on the conversion types array with a tag identifier matching the given String
      Parameters:
      str - The tag identifier of the desired ConversionType
      Returns:
      Returns the first ConversionType on the array with a tag identifier matching str, returns null if no ConversionType is found
